poem:
Title: "Cargo Ships in the Morning Light"

The cargo ship glides through the Cape,
a chess piece in a fragile geopolitical game.
Marked as dangerous, chased by shadows,
its voyage mirroring our broken world.

Under the silent gaze of the Good Hope,
the waves whisper secrets of ancient commitment,
where strength dwells in staying,
in asserting, 'I shall endure,' 
and mankind's frailty meets oceanic fortitude.
